result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Chad L Conrath in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss and read-in. Court grants and the matter are dismissed and read-in.

Defendant Chad L Conrath in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting a plea date. Court grants  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Court's response to Attorney Weathers' request for clarification of case consolidation.
Filed by Attorney Weathers requesting clarification of cases split between Judge Maxwell and Judge Ramirez
Hearing at 01-27-2016 09:00 am

Defendant Chad L Conrath in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   Brian Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting a new date to try and resolve all these matter at once in Br. 3. State has no objections. Court grants. Judge Maxwell will transfer these matter to Judge Ramirez upon his approval.
